sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 5-7 feet tall)

entries.name: Age
entries: An incola reaches adulthood at the age of 24 and generally lives up to 140 years.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|PHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Legacy of Secundix
entries: As an Incola your bloodline is blessed by one of the dieties of Secundix. Your form may resemble any race in the multiverse to a degree but those features are far gone and replaced.

When you reach character levels 3 and 5, you learn a higher-level spell, as shown on the table. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the legacy).

entries.caption: Legacies of Secundix
rows: You know the {@spell Blade Ward|PHB} cantrip.
You know the {@spell True Strike|PHB} cantrip.

entries.name: Infernal Arts
entries: You know the {@spell Fire Bolt|PHB} cantrip. When you cast it with this trait, the spell uses the same spellcasting ability you use for your Fiendish Legacy Trait.

entries.name: Inferno Acclimation
entries: You have Resistance to Fire damage.
Place Holder, holder of places

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 5-7 feet tall)

entries.name: Age
entries: An incola reaches adulthood at the age of 24 and generally lives up to 140 years.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|PHB} with a range of 60 feet.

When you reach character levels 3 and 5, you learn a higher-level spell, as shown on the table. You always have that spell prepared. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the legacy).

entries.caption: Legacies of Secundix
rows: You know the {@spell Spare the Dying|PHB} cantrip.
You know the {@spell Mage Hand|PHB} cantrip.
You know the {@spell Mold Earth|XGE} cantrip.

entries.name: Infernal Arts
entries: You know the {@spell Mind Sliver|TCE} cantrip. When you cast it with this trait, the spell uses the same spellcasting ability you use for your Fiendish Legacy Trait.

entries.name: Sheol Acclimation
entries: You have Resistance to Psychic damage.
Place Holder, holder of places

language.name: Furial
typicalSpeakers: Once upon a time language of all Furies
now known almost exclusively by the highest deities of Secundix.

entries: Place Holder, holder of places

trait.name: Lifeless Guardian
entries: The Blood Golem is immune to charm, fright, and any form of mind control.

trait.name: Fluid Form
entries: The Blood Golem can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Blood Magic Resistance
entries: The Blood Golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and resistance to necrotic damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Blood Golem regenerates 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Blood Golem makes two Whip attacks.

action.name: Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Blood Absorption
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the Blood Golem dies, the Blood Golem regains 10 hit points.

entries.name: Physical Description
entries: Blood Golems are eerie, humanoid forms created from a combination of liquid and coagulated blood. Their bodies are in a constant state of flow, appearing to be made of viscous, ever-shifting blood. Despite their lack of bones, they maintain a humanoid shape through sheer magical force. Their fluid nature grants them a range of liquid-like abilities, making them unique among constructs and undead.

entries.name: Origins and Creation
entries: The Blood Golems were the creations of the House of Snagakins, a lineage of goblin vampire lords who once ruled the old continent. The Snagakins were deeply connected with blood, practicing blood rituals and wielding blood magic. As part of their dark arts, they used the blood of their slaves to create the Blood Golems, intended as tireless guardians for their crypts and catacombs.

The House of Snagakins used these Blood Golems to protect their strongholds, tombs, and places of ritual. After the extinction of the vampire lords, many Blood Golems were left to wander the forgotten catacombs they once guarded, continuing their eternal vigil with no masters to command them.

entries.name: Lore and Behavior
entries: Blood Golems are mindless guardians, eternally patrolling the corridors and chambers of ancient catacombs tied to the House of Snagakins. They attack any intruders on sight, following the last commands of their long-dead masters. Without a will of their own, they are driven solely by the magical compulsion to guard and protect the locations they were set to watch over.

entries.name: Adventure Hooks
entries: Lost Tomb: Adventurers seeking the lost tomb of a Snagakins vampire lord must navigate through a labyrinthine catacomb filled with patrolling Blood Golems.
Ancient Relic: A powerful blood magic artifact lies hidden in a Snagakins vault, guarded by Blood Golems that need to be overcome.,
Undead Scourge: Blood Golems have begun to wander from their ancient posts, terrorizing nearby villages. Adventurers must find the source of the disturbance and put an end to the threat.

trait.name: Adaptive
entries: Gains one trait from its host.

trait.name: Soul Infestation {@recharge 5}
entries: The Saalmolch can attempt to implant a larva into a humanoid or animal it has {@condition grappled}. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or become cursed. The cursed target takes {@damage 2d10} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the curse is removed or the target reaches 1 hit point, upon which they become {@condition unconscious} and the incubation process begins. This state can be cured by removing the curse for 8 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Saalmolch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Saalmolch makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fey Step {@recharge}
entries: The Saalmolch magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.name: Physical Description
entries: Saalmolchs resemble gigantic bipedal salamanders, with most adults being of Medium size but exhibiting a Powerful Build, making them appear almost Large. The elder Saalmolchs, however, truly achieve Large size. Their young are closer to human size, progressing through various stages of growth. They have smooth, amphibian-like skin that changes color as they age:
Grubs: Brown (resembling bronze)
Young and Adults: Grey (resembling silver)
Elders: Yellow (resembling gold)

entries.name: Origins and Culture
entries: Saalmolchs are an ancient species banished from the Feywild for crimes lost to history. They live in tribal societies, eschewing the complex hierarchies of empires or nations. Despite their feylike origins, they are not true fey and thus belong to a unique category that blends traits of both fey and monstrosities.

entries.name: Lifecycle and Reproduction
entries: Saalmolchs reproduce through a gruesome parasitic process:
Implantation: A Saalmolch implants a larva into a host (animal or humanoid), targeting the host's soul rather than their physical body. This is considered a curse for removal purposes.
Soul Growth: The larva feeds on the host's soul, growing within it. At this stage, the infestation can be removed as a curse.

Physical Manifestation: Once sufficiently grown, the larva transitions to a physical form, consuming the host from within. This stage is typically fatal to the host and no longer curable by simple means. Surgical removal might be possible but would result in severe physical and spiritual damage.

entries.name: Ecology and Behavior
entries: Saalmolchs inhabit secluded, forested areas where they can hunt and implant their larvae without interference. They are apex predators within their ecosystems but prefer to remain hidden, emerging only when necessary to sustain their lifecycle. Their tribal society is tightly knit, with elders guiding the younger members and ensuring the survival of their species.

entries.name: Interaction with Other Species
entries: With Humanoids: Saalmolchs are feared and reviled by humanoid societies due to their horrific reproductive methods. Encounters with them are often fatal or result in severe spiritual and physical trauma.
With Animals: While they can and do implant animals, creating semi-developed Saalmolchs, this practice is rare and looked down upon within their culture.

entries.name: Combat Tactics
entries: Saalmolchs prefer ambush tactics, using their powerful build to overwhelm opponents quickly.
They target lone or weakened individuals for implantation.
Elder Saalmolchs may employ rudimentary tribal magic, using nature-based spells to control their environment.

trait.name: Soul Infestation {@recharge 5}
entries: If the grub hits a creature with its bite attack, it can attempt to implant a larva. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or become cursed.  The cursed target takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the curse is removed or the target reaches 1 hit point, upon which they become {@condition unconscious} and the incubation process begins. This state can be cured by removing the curse for 8 hours.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

entries.name: Physical Description
entries: Saalmolchs resemble gigantic bipedal salamanders, with most adults being of Medium size but exhibiting a Powerful Build, making them appear almost Large. The elder Saalmolchs, however, truly achieve Large size. Their young are closer to human size, progressing through various stages of growth. trait.name: Powerful Build
entries: The Saalmolch counts as one size larger when determining its carrying capacity and the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

trait.name: Adaptive
entries: Gains one trait from its host.

The cursed target takes {@damage 1d10} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the curse is removed or the target reaches 1 hit point, upon which they become {@condition unconscious} and the incubation process begins.This state can be cured by removing the curse for 8 hours.

entries: The Saalmolch makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the Molchen Steed moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the Molchen Steed can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Adaptive
entries: Gains one trait from its host.

trait.name: Soul Infestation {@recharge 10}
entries: If the steed hits a creature with its bite attack, it can attempt to implant a larva. The target must succeed on a {@dc 6} Constitution saving throw or become cursed.  The cursed target takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the curse is removed or the target reaches 1 hit point, upon which they become {@condition unconscious} and the incubation process begins. This state can be cured by removing the curse for 8 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Molchen Steed makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its hooves.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The Molchen Hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Molchen Hund's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Adaptive
entries: Gains one trait from its host.

trait.name: Soul Infestation {@recharge 10}
entries: If the hound hits a creature with its bite attack, it can attempt to implant a larva. The target must succeed on a {@dc 8} Constitution saving throw or become cursed.  The cursed target takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the curse is removed or the target reaches 1 hit point, upon which they become {@condition unconscious} and the incubation process begins. This state can be cured by removing the curse for 8 hours.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

They target lone or weakened individuals for implantation.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The stalker has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Mist Form
entries: The stalker doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Vitality Drain {@recharge 1}
entries: On successful Bite attack the attack's target has to succeed on {@dc 12} Constitution Saving Throw or gain one stack of {@condition exhaustion} stacking up to 5th level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cambion's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The cambion can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Fiendish Blessing
entries: The AC of the cambion includes its Charisma bonus.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cambion makes two melee attacks or uses its Fire Ray twice.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fiendish Charm
entries: One humanoid the cambion can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} for 1 day. The {@condition charmed} target obeys the cambion's spoken commands. If the target suffers any harm from the cambion or another creature or receives a suicidal command from the cambion, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the cambion's Fiendish Charm for the next 24 hours.

variant.name: Demonic Cambions
entries: Few demons consort with mortals, and those with the charm or desire to usually grant their cambion children the Fiendish Charm ability. Cultists of Baphomet and Orcus can also use foul rituals to infuse their master's strength into a young or unborn child, yielding a cult champion who can wield special abilities; a cambion linked to Orcus replaces Fiendish Charm with Spawn of the Grave, and one linked to Baphomet replaces it with Horned One's Call.

entries.name: Horned One's Call
entries: When the cambion targets only one creature with the attacks of its Multiattack, it can choose one ally it can see within 30 feet. That ally can use its reaction to make one melee attack against a target of its choice.

entries.name: Spawn of the Grave
entries: At the end of each of the cambion's turns, each undead of its choice that it can see within 30 feet gains 10 temporary hit points, provided the cambion isn't {@condition incapacitated}.
In addition, this cambion can use its Innate Spellcasting ability to cast {@spell animate dead} three times per day.

variant.name: Infernal Cambions
entries: Some devils grant a unique ability to their spawn that replaces the cambion's Fiendish Charm trait; Zariel and Geryon have a penchant for spawning cambions to serve as war leaders among their followers. The two of them grant the Fury of the Nine ability in place of Fiendish Charm.

entries.name: Fury of the Nine
entries: As a bonus action, the cambion chooses another creature that can see or hear it within 120 feet. That creature gains advantage on all attack rolls and saving throws for the next minute or until the cambion uses this ability again.

A cambion is the offspring of a fiend (usually a succubus or incubus) and a humanoid (usually a human). Cambions inherit aspects of both parents, but their horns, leathery wings, and sinewy tails are hallmarks of their otherworldly parentage.

entries.name: Born to Be Bad
entries: Cambions grow into ruthless adults whose wickedness and perversion horrifies even the most devoted mortal parent. Even as a youth, a cambion identifies its rightful place as an overlord of mortals. It might orchestrate uprisings in towns and cities, gathering gangs of humanoids and lesser devils to serve it.

entries.name: Pawns of the Mighty
entries: A cambion forced to serve its fiendish parent does so out of admiration and dread, but also with the expectation that it will one day rise to a place of prominence. Cambions raised in the Nine Hells serve as soldiers, envoys, and personal attendants to greater devils. In the Abyss, a cambion carries only as much authority as it can muster through sheer strength and force of will.

entries.name: Spawn of Graz'zt
entries: The demon lord Graz'zt is fond of procreating with humanoids who have made pacts with fiends, and he has sired many cambions who help him sow chaos across the multiverse. These cambions are characterized by charcoal-black skin, cloven hooves, six-fingered hands, and unearthly beauty.
They crawl from their mother's wombs to spread corruption throughout the multiverse. What's not to love?

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Humanoid Form Only)
headerEntries: The druid is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}; {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The druid makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Returning Draining Javelin
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage and on a hit a wildshape charge or spellslots with summed worth of 4 can be expanded to cause one level of {@condition exhaustion}. This weapon returns to the weilder after being used.

action.name: Lightning Spirit
entries: The spirit appears in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. Each creature within 10 feet of the spirit (other than you) when it appears must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 2d6} lightning damage.

The spirit is friendly to you and your companions and obeys your commands. See this creature's game statistics in the Wildfire Spirit stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. You determine the spirit's appearance. Some spirits take the form of a humanoid figure made of gnarled branches covered in flame, while others look like beasts wreathed in fire.

In combat, the spirit shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. The only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are {@condition incapacitated}, the spirit can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge.
The spirit manifests for 1 hour, until it is reduced to 0 hit points, until you use this feature to summon the spirit again, or until you die.

trait.name: Lady of the Mist's chosen
entries: The druid is able to replace every damage type they deal with lightning damage.

trait.name: Immobilizing Fear
entries: When a creature that isn't a blight starts its turn within 30 feet of one or more rot butchers, that creature must make a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw. The creature has disadvantage on the save if it's within 30 feet of six or more butchers. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition frightened} of the butchers for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the creature is {@condition restrained}. At the end of each of the {@condition frightened} creature's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the Crippling Fear of all rot butchers for 24 hours.

trait.name: Awaken corpses (1/day)
entries: If in proximity of fleshy corpses, the butcher can animate as much all the corpses in 3 feet radius to create a servant it can control for an hour. The servant summoned will depent on the amount of corpses and may range from a {@creature crawling claw}, through a singular {@creature zombie} to a {@creature flesh golem}, or beyond. This servant doesn't have to be undead, it just has to be logically made out of a corpse or a mound of corpses.

action.name: Butcher Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned}. At the end of each long rest, the {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points while {@condition poisoned} in this way, it dies and instantly transforms into a CR 1/8 fiend (blight). The transformation can be undone only by a {@spell wish} spell.
